title: 1986 Chevy Alabama Army Truck: Transmission & Brake Upgrades! - Dirt Every Day Ep. 36

comments.text:
So why do people love automatics so much again?? That goes to show you if 
you ignore the recommended break in and start beating parts like you want 
them to break, they will, smart money would have been beat the old turd 
400, plus I think u may have voided a warranty or 2 with that power break 
job, nice Chevy tho just needs a manual transmission ﻿

comments.author: Ethan Kemp

comments.text:
Hello: Love your show.  Would love to see you do something with FORD, 
Explorers,  There are bunches, and bunches out there with lots and lots of 
miles. (Soccer Mom Trucks) You can get them fairly cheap and they to make 
good off road vehicles,  I picked up a 2005 with 170,000+ miles that had 
never been off road as I could tell.  Installed a quick lift kit all 4 
corners, 265 70R 17's buckshot mudders, front tow hooks, and have been 
using it  driving around the farms, and off road in field roads, trails, 
creek crossing, up and down hills, etc.  We don't have the mountains but we 
do have some pretty hairy trails.  And our mud does get very very slick, 
and deep. Mine has a 5 speed automatic, would love to have found a 5 speed 
standard, but they are far and few between.  The 4L has lots of power, and 
does very well in low range.  The 4.6L would be a beast.  Do a late model, 
high milage  FORD Explorer, and even a Chevy Blazer.  Thank you and Have a 
GOOOOOOOODay!!!!﻿

comments.author: Brandon Petroski

comments.text:
From a good running low-buck truck to a not so good-running expensive 
truck. Saddens me. BTW, we had an '81 Chevy pickup with a 6.2 diesel, that 
we swapped out for a small block chevy engine out of a '78 Caprice (with 
all the mounts, bracket, and ex. manifolds from the Caprice). That was 
almost a perfect bolt-in except for the exhaust...and even that was REALLY 
close. Keep it simple man. Not everybody can afford to install a CTS engine 
in anything.﻿

comments.text:
What's the point of trailering it here and there and having mechanics bolt 
on aftermarket everything . What are we supposed to get from this?  You 
gloss over the good stuff..the starter malfunction..tranny blow up..dead 
battery out of gas. Not really interesting watching you  squander tens of 
thousands at shops on an old beater. It was cooler before you bolted a 
zillion bucks worth of stuff into it ( that doesn't work).﻿
